oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Carbsil gang, 1932
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Transforming the Economy
Industry
African American men; African Americans -- Employment
Employees; Men; Miners
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: George Teers, Granville Booker, Henry Fleming, and W. A. Johnson in an informal group portrait.
Carsbil Pigment Plant at Southall started in 1928 and ran until the end of World War II. W.A. Johnson used local labor to mine the slate and then burn it to make paint pigment.
